title: Max Hollingsworth
text:
Max Hollingsworth (22 October 1913 – 11 August 1968) was an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1930s.
Background.
Hollingsworth was born in <a href="Yass%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Yass, New South Wales</a> on 22 October 1913 and lived his early life in Armidale. 
Playing career.
He came to <a href="St.%20George%20Dragons">St. George</a> for three seasons between 1933 and 1935, the highlight probably being a member of the St. George team that played in the <a href="1933%20NSWRFL%20season">1933 Final</a>. 
He played in the 1933 decider that was won by <a href="Newtown%20Jets">Newtown</a> 18–5. He also scored four tries in St George's biggest ever win. This happened in a match against newcomers <a href="Canterbury%20Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury-Bankstown</a> in Round 5 1935 at <a href="Earl%20Park%2C%20Arncliffe">Earl Park, Arncliffe</a>, the final score was 91–6. As of the 2019 NRL season, this remains the biggest recorded victory by a team and the biggest winning margin.
Death.
Hollingsworth died at his <a href="Beverly%20Hills%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Beverly Hills, New South Wales</a> home on 11 August 1968, aged 54.
